text.text_translated: Asteroids that might hit Earth are rocks that pass less than 7.5 million kilometres from Earth's orbit. NASA has made a map of 1,400 of these rocks, but they do not expect any of them to be a danger in the next 100 years. NASA can use the technology they have now to follow these objects. They can also predict if they might hit Earth. If this happens, they could launch two ways to protect our planet.
